name: electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/447/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at grid-connected reservoir (alpine region)  hydropower plants in Peru.  This dataset is based on the dataset: "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, GLO" (accessed October 2017) and adapted using some regional data.The regional data was obtained from peruvian hydro power plants, including: efficiency, land use transformation, and water consumption. Data from nine hydropower plants was used. These plants represent 63% of  the hydropower generation in the country in 2014. The plants are: Mantaro (26%), Restitución(8%), Cañon del Pato (7%), Platanal (6%), Yuncan (4%), San Gaban (4%), Chimay (3%), Machupicchu (3%) and Charcani V (3%). Data was obtained from the Committee of Economic Operations of the National Interconnected System (COES, 2014), the national peruvian entity that regulates the dispatch and generation of energy from the electricity sector. The COES publishes the statistics of operations of the National Interconnected System (SEIN) in an annual basis. The operational statistics for year 2014 were used. In year 2014. In addition, public access information was requested from the General Directorate of Environmental Energy Affairs (DGAAE) of the Ministry of Energy and Mines of the plants in operation in 2014; these reports provided technical data on the operation of the plant. ;;Hydropower generation in 2014 was 53.45% of the production of electricity in the country, a total of 21002.83  GWh. (COES, 2014);Sources: COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, 2014. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/07_PRODUCCION HIDROELECTRICA Y RECURSOS HIDRICOS, 14 nov 2017;MINEM, 2017. Ministerio de Energía y Minas. Anuario Ejecutivo de Electricidad 2014. Dirección General de Electricidad. Retrieved online from http://www.minem.gob.pe/_estadisticaSector.php?idSector=6 , 10 January 2017.;MINEM, 2014. Balance Nacional de Energía. Retrieved online from: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/PUBLI_BNE_2014(1).pdf, 10 January 2017.

This dataset starts from the power plant ready to produce electricity, i.e. the reservoir filled with water

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes 
 - the area/volume occupied for the barrage, power station, and the lake
 - a preliminary estimation of emissions of methane and dinitrogen oxide
 - operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants, such as lubricating oil or mass of water passing through the turbines. 


This dataset doesn't include
 - land use for access roads to the reservoir
 - emissions of carbon dioxide
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets 
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The nine power plants are located throughout the country. In central Perú, department of Huancavelica, the hydropower plants of Mantaro and Restitucion are located. Platanal is  found in Lima and Chimay in Junin, also central parts of the country. The other hydropower plants that were consideredt are from Ancash, Cuzco, Puno and Arequipa. Considering he geographical location (climate) and altitude of these hydropower plants, they have been classified as "alpine region" (altitude range from 2000  to 4080 meters).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The efficiency considered in this dataset is based on the one reported in the dataset: "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed October 2017). he majority of hydroelectric power plants in the Peru are old technology (90%). Most plants in the country use Pelton turbines.  The technology used in the dataset has an overall efficiency of 82%, more modern technologies show an overall efficiency of about 88%. The overall efficiency is composed of the efficiency of the works water channel, the turbine, the generator and the transformer and are listed below:;Efficiency of power plant               current    modern;Works water channel	        0.95	     0.95;Turbine	                                        0.87	     0.91;Generator	                                        0.96      0.98;Transformer	                        0.98	     0.99;Reservoir power plant total		;without works water channel           0.82	     0.88;with works water channel                0.78	     0.84;Pumped storage power plant        0.70	    0.74;References:;Bischof, R. (1992) Modernisierungspotential bei bestehenden Wasserkraftwerken. Vortrag beim Schweizerischen Technischen Verband, Sektion Graubünden, 21. Oktober 1992. Churwalden, Schweiz [unpublished].;König F., von (1985) Bau von Wasserkraftanlagen. C.F. Müller, Karlsruhe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed October 2017), which in turn is based on a Swiss dataset for reservoir hydropower plants. Some of the exchanges and parameters were regionalized with data from Peruvian power plants, including: efficiency, land use transformation, and water consumption. Data from the following nine plants was used: Mantaro, Restitución, Cañon del Pato, Platanal, Yuncan, San Gaban, Chimay, Machupicchu and Charcani V.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from nine hydropower plants was used. These plants represent 63% of  hydropower generation in the country in 2014. The plants are: Mantaro (26%), Restitucion(8%), Cañon del Pato (7%), Platanal (6%), Yuncan (4%), San Gaban (4%), Chimay (3%), Machupicchu (3%) and Charcani V (3%). Data was obtained from the Committee of Economic Operations of the National Interconnected System (COES),  Source: COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, 2014. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/07_PRODUCCION HIDROELECTRICA Y RECURSOS HIDRICOS, 14 nov 2017

A weighted average using the value of transformation,to lake, artificial, from the peruvian dataset (electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 2008-2008" - accessed October 2017) and extrapolated considering the production of the nine hydropower plants.  (Ministerio de Energía y Minas, 2014; Subdirección de Gestión de la Información. In the peruvian dataset (electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 2008-2008" - accessed October 2017), this value was calculated using the value reported in the literature (Flury and Frischknecht, 2012) 
Sources data: Flury, K.; Frischknecht, R.; 2012. Life Cycle Inventories of Hydroelectric Power Generation,  ESU-services Ltd., fair consulting in sustainability.

Calculated value assuming the water consumed  is the water, turbine use (m3/kWh). The turbined volumes were considered for the nine powerr plants, found in  the following country statistics: COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, 2014. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/07_PRODUCCION HIDROELECTRICA Y RECURSOS HIDRICOS, 14 nov 2017

Estimation. The value is taken from "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed October 2017), that reports tha it is based on data of Swiss reservoir power plants. The lubricating oil is in a closed loop system (i.e. cannot get into the turbined water system) and is disposed annualy as waste oil in a hazardous waste treatment plant. The information given is based on own assumptions.

exchanges.description: Value taken over from "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed October 2017).
Value taken over from "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 1945-2015" (accessed October 2017).

Value taken over from "electricity production, hydro, reservoir, alpine region, PE, 1945-2015" (accessed October 2017). The comment in the original dataset is as follows: 
Estimation. Total emissions of greenhouse gases are assumed to be 0.3 CO2equivalents per kWh. Research projects in Swiss natural lakes had measurements of 8-16 micromol per m2 and day (brutto emissions). Because of the limited rates of nitrification and denitrification, a maximum of 0.24 to 2.4 micromol per m2 and Tag can be assumed for Swiss reservoir plants.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. A weighted average based on net electricity production and water for turbine use (m3/kWh) of the nine hydropower plants.  (Ministerio de Energía y Minas, 2014; Subdirección de Gestión de la Información. COES, 2014).                                                                                                                                               

Power plant: MANTARO, Net electricity production: 5409 GWh water: 3030 million m3
Power plant: RESTITUCIÓN, Net electricity production: 1629 GWh water: 2724 million m3
Power plant: CAÑON DEL PATO, Net electricity production: 1430 GWh water: 1505 million m3
Power plant: PLATANAL, Net electricity production: 1167 GWh water: 778 million m3
Power plant: YUNCAN, Net electricity production: 921 GWh water: 726 million m3
Power plant: SAN GABAN, Net electricity production: 774 GWh water: 468 million m3
Power plant: CHIMAY, Net electricity production: 714 GWh water: 1397 million m3
Power plant: MACHUPICCHU, Net electricity production: 671 GWh water: 816 million m3
Power plant: CHARCANI V, Net electricity production: 559 GWh water: 346 million m3
